alert.note: Alert for Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 16 at 7:47AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...The following area, Taiya River. This includes the city of Dyea and Skagway. * WHEN...From this evening through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, other low-lying areas and flood-prone locations. Heavy rainfall may increase the risk of rock slide activity near the Skagway dock. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A quick moving but moist atmospheric river is still on track and will move across the northern inner channels starting Tuesday afternoon and persist into Wednesday evening. The Taiya River water level will rise through the event and may go over minor flood stage by Wednesday morning. Forecast rain amounts range of 1.5 to 2.5 inches with locally higher amounts will break some daily rainfall records. The heaviest precipitation will be from Tuesday night through Wednesday afternoon before the system slides to the southeast Wednesday evening.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
